name: Leadership
description: Leadership across these episodes centers on how product and growth leaders set direction, make high-stakes decisions under uncertainty, and build operating systems that scale execution without losing judgment, ethics, or humanity. It also covers the interpersonal craft—narrative, feedback, conflict, and resilience—because alignment and team health often determine whether strategy and experimentation actually translate into outcomes.
subtopics: Leading through uncertainty and rapid change (AI shifts, market shifts, platform shifts): how to decide, adapt, and communicate when the map is wrong
Operating systems for scale: mechanisms, cadence, metrics, and org design that turn principles into repeatable execution
Decision quality and alignment: structured disagreement, pre-mortems/kill criteria, and “disagree-and-commit” to move fast without thrash
Strategic narrative and sensemaking: framing an “old game → new game” shift to align product, GTM, recruiting, and fundraising
People leadership fundamentals: delivering hard feedback, performance management, role clarity, and building high-talent, high-trust teams
Sustainable leadership: burnout signals, energy management, and psychological resilience as prerequisites for long-term effectiveness
common_frameworks: Mechanism-driven leadership (Amazon-style): working backwards, input vs output metrics, single-threaded leadership, and decision mechanisms that scale
Disagree-and-commit + structured disagreement (separating discovery/discussion/decision; surfacing assumptions explicitly)
Pre-mortems and kill criteria (define what would make you stop; track leading indicators to shorten feedback loops)
Strategic narrative: “shift in the world” framing (old game → new game) as a CEO-level alignment tool
Environment vs skills diagnosis (separating constraints of the system from individual capability gaps before prescribing solutions)
Energy and resilience practices (manage energy not just time; recognize burnout ‘red alarms’; build psychological durability for hard calls)
